title: Game Masters: Blizzard Entertainment interview
other_title: Game Masters: Rob Pardo and Chris Metzen
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Video games
abstract: Vice Presidents Rob Pardo and Chris Metzen discuss their work and the successes that have made Blizzard Entertainment famous. Filmed as part of ACMI's 'Game Masters' exhibition.
description: Blizzard Entertainment is a world leading developer and publisher renowned for creating some of the industry’s most critically acclaimed games. Blizzard’s first success was in 1994 with 'Warcraft: Orcs and Humans', a game that laid the foundations for the burgeoning real-time strategy genre, introducing gameplay features that would become standards. In 1996 the company released the action-role-playing-game 'Diablo'. With a track record that includes thirteen number one games and multiple Game of the Year awards, Blizzard Entertainment has gone on to establish one of the largest online followings of any game company worldwide.  The company is best known for the subscription-based massively multiplayer online role-playing games 'World of Warcraft' (2004), and 'StarCraft' (1998) series. NB: Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: VoD Program; B2002597; Game Masters: the interviews; Active; 2012
